video_title: Trump Adds Venezuela to Visa Bond List
topic: trump adds venezuela to list of countries whose citizens must post bonds for u.s. visas

text: The US Department of State announced that it has added Venezuela to the list of countries whose citizens are required to post bonds in order to obtain a US visa.
This move is part of a visa bond pilot program that aims to improve compliance with US immigration laws.
Citizens of certain countries, including Afghanistan, Angola, and the Democratic Republic of the Congo, among others, are required to pay a bond.
The bond is refundable if the individual complies with the terms of their visa, including departing the US on or before the expiration date of their authorized stay.
Citizens of certain countries are required to pay a bond ranging from $5,000 to $15,000 when they apply for a US visa.
